intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. boltigense, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare and ancient plant species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant is distinguished by its yellowish flowers and hairy stems, which help it adapt to its alpine or subalpine habitats. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
